001package org.hd.d.TRVmodel.hg;
002
003/**
004 * Recreation of the heat-pump / TRV / energy interactions from Heat Geek's page:
005 * <a href="https://www.heatgeek.com/why-not-to-zone-heat-pumps-or-boilers/">https://www.heatgeek.com/why-not-to-zone-heat-pumps-or-boilers/</a>
006 * as of ~2023-06.
007 * <p>
008 * This is examining if turning down TRVs in unused rooms saves energy or not,
009 * as is commonly assumed eg with gas-fired heating.
010 * <p>
011 * Many thanks to Heat Geek for making this analysis and explanation available.
012 * <p>
013 * This is a simple model, mirroring the page above.
014 * <p>
015 * This model is steady-state, ie in temperature equilibrium.
016 * <p>
017 * In this model there are 4 rooms in house in a square in the pattern:
018 * <table border="1">
019 * <tr><td>A</td><td>B</td></tr>
020 * <tr><td>B</td><td>A</td></tr>
021 * </table>
022 * <p>
023 * Where the <em>A</em> rooms are kept at the 'normal' 21&deg;C living temperature,
024 * and the <em>B</em> rooms are kept at the same temperature as A or at a lower 18&deg;C setback.
025 * These temperatures (especially those in the B rooms) are regulated by TRVs
026 * controlling the radiator heat emitters in each room.
027 * <p>
028 * (Note that this arrangement maximises internal heat transfers between rooms
029 * when Bs are at setback temperature; swap any horizontal or vertical pair to minimise instead.)
030 * <p>
031 * The rooms can be considered to be in a horizontal plane,
032 * with the area outside the rooms being at exterior temperature.
033 * <p>
034 * The external walls are of different construction to
035 * the internal walls between the A and B rooms.
036 * Heat flow through these walls is modelled.
037 * <p>
038 * Heat loss through ceilings and floors and all other routes is ignored.
039 * <p>
040 * This model looks to the total input electric energy input demand
041 * to a heat pump to maintain the specified steady state,
042 * taking into account implied flow water temperatures
043 * and the heat-pump CoP to reach those flow temperatures.
044 * <p>
045 * <blockquote>
046 * To keep the maths simple, each room has a 500 W heat loss at design outside temperature of -3&deg;C or 2 kW in total with a room temperature of 21&deg;C. They are also each fitted with a mean water-to-air temperature DT25 [MW-AT DT25] radiator, meaning that each radiator will output 500 W, when its average surface temperature is 25&deg;C above the room temperature.
047 * </blockquote>
048 * <p>
049 * For step 1 the home heat loss is verified to be 83.3W/K as stated, with testHLWpK().
050 * <p>
051 * For step 2 the B rooms are lowered to the setback temperature (18&deg;C).
052 * The mean home temperature is verified to be 19.5&deg;C as stated, with testTMeanWhenSetback().
053 */
054public final class HGTRVHPMModel
055        {
056        /**Prevent creation of an instance. */
057    private HGTRVHPMModel() { }
058
059    /**tExt: external air temperature, ie design temperature on cold winter day, (Celsius). */
060    public static final double EXTERNAL_AIR_TEMPERATURE_C = -3;
061    /**tInt: 'normal' room temperature (Celsius). */
062    public static final double NORMAL_ROOM_TEMPERATURE_C = 21;
063    /**HLDT: design temperature (cold winter day) for heat loss calculations (Kelvin). */
064    public static final double HOME_HEAT_LOSS_DESIGN_TEMPERATURE_DELTA_K =
065                (NORMAL_ROOM_TEMPERATURE_C - EXTERNAL_AIR_TEMPERATURE_C);
066    /**hlW: (Flow Temperature, step 1) heat loss with all rooms at normal internal temperature (W). */
067    public static final double HOME_HEAT_LOSS_AT_NORMAL_ROOM_TEMPERATURE_W = 2000;
068    /**radW: pre-setback radiator output (W). */
069    public static final double RADIATOR_POWER_WITH_HOME_AT_NORMAL_ROOM_TEMPERATURE_W = 500;
070    /**radMWATdT: no-setback Mean Water to Air Temperature delta T (K). */
071    public static final double RADIATOR_MWATDT_AT_NORMAL_ROOM_TEMPERATURE_K = 25;
072
073
074    /**HLpK: (Flow Temperature, step 1) heat loss per Kelvin (W/K). */
075    public static final double HOME_HEAT_LOSS_PER_KELVIN_WpK =
076                HOME_HEAT_LOSS_AT_NORMAL_ROOM_TEMPERATURE_W / HOME_HEAT_LOSS_DESIGN_TEMPERATURE_DELTA_K;
077
078    /**tIntSetback: setback/unused room temperature (Celsius). */
079    public static final double SETBACK_ROOM_TEMPERATURE_C = 18;
080    /**tMeanWhenSetback: (Flow Temperature, step 2) mean home temperature when B rooms setback (Celcius). */
081    public static final double MEAN_HOME_TEMPERATURE_WITH_SETBACK_C =
082                (NORMAL_ROOM_TEMPERATURE_C + SETBACK_ROOM_TEMPERATURE_C) / 2;
083    /**HLsbW: (Flow Temperature, step 3) heat loss with B rooms setback (W). */
084    public static final double HOME_HEAT_LOSS_B_SETBACK_W = HOME_HEAT_LOSS_PER_KELVIN_WpK *
085                (MEAN_HOME_TEMPERATURE_WITH_SETBACK_C - EXTERNAL_AIR_TEMPERATURE_C);
086    /**HLfall: (Flow Temperature, step 3) reduction in home heat loss with B set back. */
087    public static final double HOME_HEAT_LOSS_FALL_B_SETBACK =
088                (HOME_HEAT_LOSS_AT_NORMAL_ROOM_TEMPERATURE_W - HOME_HEAT_LOSS_B_SETBACK_W) /
089                        HOME_HEAT_LOSS_AT_NORMAL_ROOM_TEMPERATURE_W;
090
091    /**IWL: (Heat Loss 1.0) internal wall length of each intra-room wall (m). */
092    public static final double INTERNAL_WALL_LENGTH_M = 4;
093    /**IWH: (Heat Loss 1.0) internal wall height of each intra-room wall (m). */
094    public static final double INTERNAL_WALL_HEIGHT_M = 2.3;
095    /**IWA: (Heat Loss 1.0) internal wall area of each internal intra-room wall (m^2). */
096    public static final double INTERNAL_WALL_AREA_PER_WALL_M2 = INTERNAL_WALL_HEIGHT_M * INTERNAL_WALL_LENGTH_M;
097    /**IDA: (Heat Loss 1.0) internal door area per door - test says one in each internal wall (m^2). */
098    public static final double INTERNAL_DOOR_AREA_PER_DOOR_M2 = 2;
099    /**IWU: (Heat Loss 1.0) internal wall U value (W/m^2K).
100     * An internal stud wall with plasterboard is ~1.7, a single brick wall with plaster ~1.2.
101     * <p>
102     * Also used for internal floor U value for simplicity, eg given
103     * plasterboard then 8 inch joist space then tongue-and-groove boards ~1.4/1.7.
104     * <p>
105     * See: https://www.diydata.com/information/u_values/u_values.php
106     */
107    public static final double INTERNAL_WALL_U_WpM2K = 2;
108    /**IWU: (Heat Loss 1.0) internal door U value (W/m^2K).
109     * Possibly a bit high (solid wood external door ~3.0), but may not be shut tight for example.
110     * <p>
111     * See: https://www.bregroup.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/10/BR443-October-2019_consult.pdf
112     */
113    public static final double INTERNAL_DOOR_U_WpM2K = 8;
114    /**IWAab: (heat loss 1.1) internal wall area between each A and adjoining B rooms (m^2). */
115    public static final double INTERNAL_WALL_AREA_FROM_EACH_A_TO_B_ROOM_M2 = 2 * INTERNAL_WALL_AREA_PER_WALL_M2;
116    /**IWAabmd: (Heat Loss 1.2) internal wall area between each A and adjoining B rooms minus one door (m^2).
117     * Note: inconsistent with text that says one door per internal wall rather than per pair.
118     */
119    public static final double INTERNAL_WALL_AREA_FROM_EACH_A_TO_B_ROOM_MINUS_DOOR_M2 =
120                INTERNAL_WALL_AREA_FROM_EACH_A_TO_B_ROOM_M2 - INTERNAL_DOOR_AREA_PER_DOOR_M2;
121    /**IWAabHL: (Heat Loss 1.3) internal wall (minus door) heat loss per Kelvin (W/K). */
122    public static final double INTERNAL_WALL_MINUS_DOOR_HEAT_LOSS_PER_KELVIN_WpK =
123                INTERNAL_WALL_AREA_FROM_EACH_A_TO_B_ROOM_MINUS_DOOR_M2 * INTERNAL_WALL_U_WpM2K;
124    /**IWAabHLW: (Heat Loss 1.4) internal wall (minus door) heat loss (WK). */
125    public static final double INTERNAL_WALL_MINUS_DOOR_HEAT_LOSS_W =
126                INTERNAL_WALL_MINUS_DOOR_HEAT_LOSS_PER_KELVIN_WpK *
127                (NORMAL_ROOM_TEMPERATURE_C - SETBACK_ROOM_TEMPERATURE_C);
128    /**IDAabHL: (Heat Loss 1.5) internal door heat loss per door per Kelvin (W/K). */
129    public static final double INTERNAL_DOOR_HEAT_LOSS_PER_KELVIN_WpK =
130                INTERNAL_DOOR_AREA_PER_DOOR_M2 * INTERNAL_DOOR_U_WpM2K;
131    /**IDAabHLW: (Heat Loss 1.6) internal door heat loss per door (W). */
132    public static final double INTERNAL_DOOR_HEAT_LOSS_W =
133                INTERNAL_DOOR_HEAT_LOSS_PER_KELVIN_WpK *
134                        (NORMAL_ROOM_TEMPERATURE_C - SETBACK_ROOM_TEMPERATURE_C);
135    /**IDWAabHLW: (Heat Loss 1.7) internal wall and door heat loss per A room (W). */
136    public static final double INTERNAL_WALL_AND_DOOR_HEAT_LOSS_PER_A_ROOM_W =
137                INTERNAL_WALL_MINUS_DOOR_HEAT_LOSS_W + INTERNAL_DOOR_HEAT_LOSS_W;
138
139    /**radWAbs: (Heat Loss 2.0) radiator output in each A room when B setback (W). */
140    public static final double RADIATOR_POWER_IN_A_ROOMS_WHEN_B_SETBACK_W =
141                RADIATOR_POWER_WITH_HOME_AT_NORMAL_ROOM_TEMPERATURE_W + INTERNAL_WALL_AND_DOOR_HEAT_LOSS_PER_A_ROOM_W;
142    /**radWBbs: (Heat Loss 2.0) radiator output in each B room when B setback (W). */
143    public static final double RADIATOR_POWER_IN_B_ROOMS_WHEN_B_SETBACK_W =
144                (HOME_HEAT_LOSS_B_SETBACK_W - 2*RADIATOR_POWER_IN_A_ROOMS_WHEN_B_SETBACK_W) / 2;
145    /**radWAmult: (Heat Loss 2.1) radiator output increase multiplier in each A room when B setback. */
146    public static final double RADIATOR_POWER_UPLIFT_IN_A_ROOMS_WHEN_B_SETBACK_MULTIPLIER =
147                RADIATOR_POWER_IN_A_ROOMS_WHEN_B_SETBACK_W / RADIATOR_POWER_WITH_HOME_AT_NORMAL_ROOM_TEMPERATURE_W;
148        /**MWATP2Dexp: (Heat Loss 2.2) exponent to go from power increase to delta-T increase. */
149    public static final double RADIATOR_EXP_POWER_TO_DT = 0.77;
150    /**radAbsdTmult: (Heat Loss 2.3) radiator MW-AT delta-T increase multiplier in each A room when B setback. */
151    public static final double RADIATOR_DT_UPLIFT_IN_A_ROOMS_WHEN_B_SETBACK_MULTIPLIER =
152                Math.pow(RADIATOR_POWER_UPLIFT_IN_A_ROOMS_WHEN_B_SETBACK_MULTIPLIER, RADIATOR_EXP_POWER_TO_DT);
153    /**radAbsdT: (Heat Loss 2.4) radiator MW-AT delta-T in each A room when B setback (K). */
154    public static final double RADIATOR_DT_IN_A_ROOMS_WHEN_B_SETBACK_K =
155                RADIATOR_MWATDT_AT_NORMAL_ROOM_TEMPERATURE_K * RADIATOR_DT_UPLIFT_IN_A_ROOMS_WHEN_B_SETBACK_MULTIPLIER;
156    /**radAbsMW: (Heat Loss 2.5) radiator mean water temperature in each A room when B setback (C). */
157    public static final double RADIATOR_MW_IN_A_ROOMS_WHEN_B_SETBACK_C =
158                NORMAL_ROOM_TEMPERATURE_C + RADIATOR_DT_IN_A_ROOMS_WHEN_B_SETBACK_K;
159
160    /**CoPA2W46p0: (Heat Pump Efficiency) suggested HP CoP at 46.0C flow temperature. */
161    public static final double COP_AT_46p0C = 2.6;
162    /**CoPA2W51p5: (Heat Pump Efficiency) suggested HP CoP at 51.5C flow temperature. */
163    public static final double COP_AT_51p5C = 2.3;
164    /**CoPDropPerK: (Heat Pump Efficiency) suggested approximate fall in CoP per K rise in flow temperature. */
165    public static final double COP_DROP_pK = 0.025;
166    /**HPinWnsb: (Heat Pump Efficiency) heat-pump electrical power in when B not setback (W).
167     * Note that flow and mean temperatures seem to be being mixed here.
168     */
169    public static final double HEAT_PUMP_POWER_IN_NO_SETBACK_W =
170                HOME_HEAT_LOSS_AT_NORMAL_ROOM_TEMPERATURE_W / COP_AT_46p0C;
171    /**HPinWsb: (Heat Pump Efficiency) heat-pump electrical power in when B is setback (W).
172     * Note that flow and mean temperatures seem to be being mixed here.
173     */
174    public static final double HEAT_PUMP_POWER_IN_B_SETBACK_W =
175                HOME_HEAT_LOSS_B_SETBACK_W / COP_AT_51p5C;
176        }
